It can be tedious to keep track of your investment history, especially in crypto – given the pace of market changes, transaction frequency, and diverse portfolio assets necessitate an efficient and reliable tracking system.

In today's article, we will cover how to create your own portfolio tracker on Excel, allowing for simpler and quicker insights into your trade history. Streamline your trade history management and enjoy a clear overview of your investment performance. We will also be utilizing the CoinGecko API to fetch real-time and historical price data for various cryptocurrencies, and get an accurate and up-to-date record of our investments.

This guide is applicable for both macOS and Windows users.

Pre-requisites

Before diving in, ensure you have the following ready:

  • Microsoft Excel software
  • CoinGecko Demo API key

In order to get your Demo API key, first create an account via the Pricing page. Thereafter, you'll be directed to the Developer Dashboard where you can generate your API key. We will be accessing the /coins/markets endpoint to obtain CoinGecko’s price for a list of cryptocurrencies on a specific date. This provides an aggregated price for your selected cryptocurrency, relative to any currency, on the date it was involved in a transaction.

Setting Up Your Excel Spreadsheet

The Excel document provided in this article is a base template, which you can customize in any way you’d like. I opted to start with a simple breadth of categories including:

  • Symbol: The symbol of your traded cryptocurrency
  • Long/Short: Whether you have sold or bought that currency - this will alter the profit/loss column, which is calculated using the following formula: =IF(ISBLANK(“Not in a position”),"", IF(Position="Short",(Exit Size-Entry Size)*-1, IF(Position="Long", Entry Size-Exit Size, "")))
  • Entry Price, Quantity, and Open Date: The price, quantity, and date of your initial trade to enter the position
  • Strategy: Whatever trading strategy you have utilized with this position
  • Risk:Reward: Measure of your prospective reward given the risk you’ve undertaken
  • Stop Loss: If you happen to have a stop loss currently placed
  • Exit Date: Left blank if you are currently in the position
  • Current Price: Uses the following formula to find the same symbol on the raw data page and the corresponding price, and will be discussed in more detail later on. Formula: =INDEX(Raw Data Page!Price Column:Price Column, MATCH(Symbol on current page, Raw Data Page!Symbol Column:Symbol Column, 0))
  • Fees: Any gas fees or transaction costs involved
  • Entry Position Size & Exit Position Size: Simply the quantity x price of the respective entry and exit trades
  • Position P/L: The current profit and loss of a position given the current price of the cryptocurrency, or the price at which you exited the position
  • Status: Closed/Open, following an IF statement: =IF(ISBLANK(J26), "Open", "Closed")

There is space at the top of the Excel spreadsheet where you can include an array of metrics, tailored to your own portfolio. I included visuals on the number of open positions, the P&L of the portfolio, the number of wins/losses given the selected strategy (which appears as a dropdown menu at the top of the image), and an assortment of other statistics.

All the values displayed on the template are completely arbitrary and do not resemble actual transaction data.

Getting 'Data from Web' in Excel

How to Import Crypto Prices into Excel (for Windows Users)

The process to receive data from the web on Windows is quite simple:

  1. Click the cell you would like the data to be imported into.

  2. Select the Data Ribbon and go to 'From Web'.

  3. Enter the URL as copied from the CoinGecko API documentation as shown below, and click 'Connect' to select and import web data.

Once the parameters are added, you can find the corresponding URL in the curl request after you’ve selected ‘Try It’. This is shown in the orange box above. Simply copy this URL and place it into the 'From Web' request on Excel.

This in-depth tutorial covers how to import crypto prices into Excel.

How to Import Crypto Prices into Excel (for Mac Users)

On a Mac operating system, there is no 'Data From Web' option on the data ribbon tab of your Microsoft Excel.

To circumvent this issue, we will take the URL from the CoinGecko API, as done before, and open TextEdit.

  1. The quickest way to do this would be to open your search bar by hitting “F4” and then typing in TextEdit.

  1. The final step before we can input our data into Excel is to save the document as a ‘.iqy’ file. This will allow us to run a mac Web query on Excel. To do this simply add ‘.iqy’ after the name of your file and unselect the box labeled “If no extension is provided use ‘txt’”.

Cross-asset Allocation

Should your portfolio extend to other assets beyond crypto, you can simply add them into the respective ‘Symbol’ column. If you’re trading equities, say AAPL, simply add in the details of your position into a row (row 47 in the above sheet) and it will be incorporated into your portfolio analysis. content.__text:
How to Earn Solv Points

Solv is a decentralized platform that enables bitcoin holders to put their BTC to work and earn yield through the Decentralized Bitcoin Reserve. Users can earn points by holding SolvBTC and interacting with the SolvBTC ecosystem through staking, providing liquidity, and more.

Key Takeaways

  • Solv Protocol is a platform that enables bitcoin holders to utilize their assets and earn yield through the Decentralized Bitcoin Reserve.

  • The protocol has successfully raised $16 million and is backed by investors such as Binance Labs, Blockchain Capital, Laser Digital, and more.

  • Users can now participate and earn points in the Solv Points system by holding and staking SolvBTC.

What Is Solv Protocol?

Solv Protocol is a decentralized platform for enhancing yield and liquidity across major assets within the cryptocurrency ecosystem by establishing a Decentralized Bitcoin Reserve. The project aims to build a platform where BTC assets can flow across blockchain networks to unify Bitcoin’s liquidity and amplify its utility. Currently, bitcoin (BTC) holders are unable to deploy their assets on other blockchains, resulting in idle BTC.

The Decentralized Bitcoin Reserve is built on three pillars in order to address various aspects needed to create a comprehensive and compliant product. First is the Liquidity Consensus Network (LCN) which serves as the operational core to manage liquidity and ensure smooth cross-chain interactions. The LCN provides dynamic liquidity management by handling and managing Bitcoin within the reserve. It also supports the transfer of Bitcoin assets across different blockchain networks and integrates liquidity from diverse sources. On top of that, the LCN operates with transparent and auditable records as well as regular reporting to provide transparency and network safety.

The second pillar is Solv Protocol’s implementation of UTXO-3525, a protocol that maps Bitcoin transactions to the ERC-3525 standard. This protocol enables the transfer of Bitcoin-related assets such as BTC, Ordinals, and Runes from the Bitcoin chain to EVM-compatible networks. By mapping these transfers, users can enjoy features like uncollateralized borrowing and enhanced liquidity for Bitcoin assets. UTXO-3525 is also meant to support the reserve’s scalability by accommodating growing demand.

Facilitating traditional finance integration via the compliance bridge is the third and final pillar of the reserve. It focuses on creating an infrastructure that encourages traditional financial institutions to participate by implementing a compliant infrastructure. This includes efforts such as the tokenization of BTC ETFs as well as comprehensive reporting and auditing capabilities that can meet the requirements of traditional finance participants.

SolvBTC is a Liquid Yield token kept in the reserves and backed 1:1 by Bitcoin. Users who participate on Solv Protocol can earn yield with SolvBTC by utilizing yield vaults or exploring DeFi opportunities. Depositing SolvBTC into Yield Vaults provides access to BTC Staking, Restaking, and Delta-Neutral Trading strategies. Meanwhile, SolvBTC can also be staked and converted into liquid staking tokens such as SolvBTC.BBN and SolvBTC.ENA. It is currently deployed on five major networks including Bitcoin mainnet, Ethereum mainnet, and BNB chain.

Solv Protocol has successfully raised $16 million across five funding rounds and is backed by prominent investors including Binance Labs, Blockchain Capital, Laser Digital, and more. The protocol has also undergone security audits by various firms such as Quantstamp, Certik SlowMist, Salus, and Secbit.

Interested users can now participate in the Solv Points system to earn points by holding SolvBTC and interacting with the SolvBTC ecosystem. Given the growing interest in deploying Bitcoin assets across other chains, now is a good time to explore the Solv Protocol ecosystem and earn points!

Do take note that at the time of writing, the Solv Protocol team has not made any official announcements regarding a token launch. Therefore, participating in the Solv Points system by following the steps below does not guarantee a future token airdrop allocation.

Step 1: Connect Wallet

First, head over to https://app.solv.finance/points and Connect your wallet either on the main screen or in the top right corner.

There are a few wallet options to choose from and in this guide, we will be using MetaMask.

Do make sure that whichever wallet you select has a form of BTC asset such as WBTC on Arbitrum or FBTC on Ethereum as well as enough ETH to cover gas fees.

Step 2: Get SolvBTC

Now that your wallet is connected, it is time to get some SolvBTC!

In the top menu bar, head over to SolvBTC on the left.

Here you can choose which network you want to deposit your BTC asset from. In this guide, we are depositing WBTC on the Arbitrum chain.

Input your deposit amount, Approve it, and Confirm the transaction in your wallet. You will then receive SolvBTC.

Holding SolvBTC is the easiest way to receive Solv Points and the following steps are optional for those who are not comfortable interacting with various protocols. However, do consider the amount of XP you can earn as it varies depending on each step.

Step 3: Stake SolvBTC (Optional)

After receiving your SolvBTC, you can proceed to stake it. At the time of writing, the Babylon campaign is currently paused, therefore we are unable to receive SOLVBTC.BB and will proceed with the SolvBTC Ethena campaign.

Do note that this step is optional as you are required to perform the Know Your Customer (KYC) process which some users may prefer not to. You can still earn Solv Points from holding SolvBTC.

In the top menu, move over to the SolvBTC.ENA page where you will need to Verify your identity. Clicking this will redirect you to the Synaps page.

You will need to provide your email address and wallet address to sign up for the KYC process. A verification code will be sent to your email for you to paste into the Synaps page.

After that, you need to perform a liveness test, in which your camera records your face moving closer to the camera and staying still.

Then, you need to upload pictures of the front and back of a government document such as a passport or driving license.

Once everything is submitted, it may take up to 24 hours for your documents to be reviewed and approved.

Do note that at the time of writing, we were unable to proceed with staking in the Ethena campaign due to an issue regarding the verification process. However, this article will be updated once the issue has been resolved.

Step 4: Provide Liquidity

Back in your top menu, head over to Liquidity to see the different DeFi protocols you can provide liquidity to. When browsing, do take into account which assets you need to have in order to participate such as SolvBTC, SolvBTC.BBN, and SolvBTC.ENA.

In this guide we will continue with the Arbitrum network. As shown below, there are a few DeFi options under Arbitrum which require different assets. For example, on DODO you can stake SolvBTC-WBTC LP, SolvBTC-SolvBTC.ENA LP, or SolvBTC-SolvBTC.BBN LP.

As some of you may prefer to only hold on to SolvBTC, for this step we will go with the simplest option which is to supply SolvBTC on Avalon.

Get Started with the option and be redirected to the Avalon page. Connect your wallet in order to supply your SolvBTC.

Input the amount you want and Approve SolvBTC to continue.

After that, Supply SolvBTC and confirm the transaction in your wallet.

Step 5: Discover the Yield Market

In the top menu, proceed to Yield Market to discover the various options there are on different chains.

We will be looking at the Arbitrum chain.

We highly recommend that you take the time to read and understand each opportunity so you are aware of the product itself.

For example, the GMX V2 USDC-A has a risk management system that will liquidate and suspend the strategy for at least 14 days if the 30-day drawdown exceeds 3%. Users can then apply for redemption at any time during this period which will be processed on the 15th and 30th of each month.

In order to participate, input how much USDC you want to pay and then Approve and Confirm the transaction.

Conclusion

Solv Protocol aims to enhance yield and liquidity opportunities for bitcoin holders by enabling cross-chain interoperability and allowing BTC assets to be transferred on other blockchain networks. Users can now earn points when participating in the Solv Points system by holding SolvBTC and interacting with various yield opportunities on DeFi protocols.

entry.title: What Is Babylon and How It Will Bring Staking to Bitcoin

content.__text:
What Is Babylon?

Babylon is an innovative project designed to improve the security of Proof-of-Stake (PoS) blockchains by enabling Bitcoin holders to earn yield by putting their idle Bitcoins to work to bolster the economic security of Proof-of-Stake (PoS) chains and dApps.

Key Takeaways

  • Babylon is an innovative project designed to improve the security of Proof-of-Stake (PoS) blockchains by allowing Bitcoin holders to earn yield by staking their Bitcoins (BTC) to improve the economic security of PoS chains and dApps.

  • Babylon leverages the three unique facets of Bitcoin, including its timestamping service, blockspace, and asset value.

  • With Babylon, Bitcoin holders can participate in Proof-of-Stake security by locking up their BTC on the Bitcoin network, which is then used to provide security for various PoS ecosystems, such as Cosmos, Polygon, and Bitcoin Layer 2s.

Babylon lets users stake Bitcoin (BTC) to secure other blockchains and protocols, expanding Bitcoin's role in the decentralized economy. This is done without the need for staked Bitcoins to be bridged, wrapped, pegged, or held in custody. It is able to achieve this by leveraging the three unique facets of Bitcoin: its timestamping service, blockspace, and asset value. The project aims to tap into security from Bitcoin, the pioneer blockchain platform, and disperse it to various PoS ecosystems, such as Cosmos, Polygon, and Bitcoin Layer 2s.

Team and Funding

The team behind Babylon features key figures and prominent scholars, including co-founders David Tse and Fisher Yu. Babylon also has a team of advisors who provide expert guidance and strategic insights. The project's ecosystem is growing through various partnerships, including Lombard, Akash Network, Binance Web3 Wallet, Injective (INJ), Cosmos Hub, and OKX Wallet.

Babylon has received strong support and funding, reflecting significant market confidence in its innovative approach. For instance, the project raised over $18 million from top investors, including Polychain Capital, Hack VC, OKX Ventures, Polygon Ventures, and so on, in December 2023. This substantial investment is directed toward developing Babylon's Bitcoin staking protocol, which aims to position Bitcoin as a decentralized staking asset.

With a strong team and substantial funding, Babylon appears to be well-positioned in the market focused on integrating Bitcoin's security into decentralized finance (DeFi). Its unique staking protocol aims to broaden Bitcoin's utility and strengthen the security of PoS blockchains, demonstrating the project's commitment to on-chain integrity.

How Does Babylon Work?

As mentioned earlier, Babylon is able to secure Proof-of-Stake chains by leveraging Bitcoin's three unique facets; timestamping service, blockspace, and asset value. These elements form the core of Babylon’s security-sharing protocols, which include the Bitcoin staking protocol, the Bitcoin timestamping protocol, and the Bitcoin data availability protocol.

These protocols work in tandem to ensure that Bitcoin's robust features are effectively utilized to bolster the security and efficiency of various PoS networks. Below is a detailed explanation of these protocols and how they work.

Bitcoin Staking Protocol

Bitcoin holders can use Babylon's Bitcoin staking protocol on PoS chains, app chains, and applications to protect the protocols and receive rewards by staking (and restaking) their BTC. Unlike the conventional staking methods, the protocol eliminates the need for the staked Bitcoins to be bridged, wrapped, or held in third-party custody.

The staking protocol has two functions, which are somewhat interwoven. Primarily, it enhances the security of Proof-of-Stake chains and applications through Bitcoin staking. Additionally, it incentivizes Bitcoin holders — through rewards — to participate in Babylon’s security model.

Source: Babylon

It is worth mentioning that the Babylon staking protocol claims that BTC deposited on the protocol are "as safe as they can possibly be." For example, staked bitcoins are safe and withdrawable so long as the participant uses the protocol in good faith and does not attack the PoS chains. Moreover, Babylon claims the unbonding of the staked asset is generally safe and prompt without the need of social consensus, due to its use of the Bitcoin timestamping protocol which allows for synchronization between Bitcoin and the PoS chains.

All in all, the BTC staking protocol is designed as a modular plug-in compatible with various Proof-of-Stake chains. By integrating Bitcoin's robust security into these other blockchains, Babylon aims to expand BTC's utility beyond being merely a store of value or a medium of exchange.

Bitcoin Timestamping Protocol

The Bitcoin timestamping protocol is another critical component of Babylon. This protocol operates by timestamping events of other blockchains onto the Bitcoin network, effectively borrowing BTC's security as a timestamping server. Basically, it allows any random data submitted to Babylon to obtain Bitcoin timestamps.

Source: Babylon

The BTC timestamping protocol is particularly useful in improving the integrity and security of PoS networks and preventing long-range attacks, which occur when a malicious validator attempts to take over a blockchain with a forked false chain. With BTC timestamps, the attacking fork will have a later BTC timestamp, which will never be chosen by anyone in a fork choice. Meanwhile, it serves as the building block of the staking protocol by establishing synchronization between Bitcoin and the PoS blockchains. This also removes the need for social consensus, as Bitcoin timestamps are objective.

Moreover, the timestamping protocol facilitates cross-chain security, fast stake unbonding, reduced cost of security, composable trust, and the bootstrapping of new chains. It achieves this by combining the short-range security of Proof-of-Stake chains with the long-range security of Proof-of-Work Bitcoin.

Bitcoin Data Availability Protocol

The Bitcoin data availability protocol utilizes Bitcoin’s limited block space for vital tasks, such as providing a censorship-resistant layer for PoS chains. Bitcoin’s blockspace, known for its unparalleled security and censorship resistance, has proven to be essential in protecting the decentralized ecosystem. The data availability protocol ensures that critical data is always obtainable and secure, further enhancing the reliability and trustworthiness of PoS chains.

Problems Tackled by Babylon

Using its various mechanisms, Babylon offers various solutions to challenges affecting the broader blockchain ecosystem. Some of these include;

Establishing Protocol Security for New Chains

New blockchain platforms tend to struggle with security issues, especially in the short period following their launch. These networks are more vulnerable to exploits and often require a robust security infrastructure to maintain their integrity in the beginning.

With Babylon, newly-launched blockchains can leverage Bitcoin's security, improving their overall stability and reliability. For instance, Babylon’s timestamping protocol can help to secure the new blockchain networks against long-range attacks by utilizing Bitcoin’s timestamps.

Increased Capital Efficiency for Bitcoin

Babylon improves capital efficiency in the Bitcoin ecosystem by enabling BTC holders to stake their coins on PoS chains through the staking protocol. As already mentioned, the staking protocol removes the need for Bitcoin to be bridged, wrapped, or held by third parties, thereby maintaining liquidity. Ultimately, this broadens the use cases of Bitcoin in the ecosystem, from the security of PoS networks to earning incentives on staked BTC.

Fast Unbonding

On many staking protocols, the process of unstaking assets can be time-consuming. This can reduce the flexibility for participants, thereby discouraging them from parting with their assets. However, Babylon’s approach of using Bitcoin timestamping for synchronization between Bitcoin and PoS chains ensures that the unstaking process is fast and users can access their funds as quickly as possible.

Partnerships and Ecosystem

As earlier mentioned, Babylon has established a robust ecosystem through strategic partnerships with various prominent projects in the blockchain space. These partnerships are not only focused on the technology; they are also about a shared vision for a more secure and efficient decentralized future. Below are some of Babylon’s key partners and ecosystem components.

Lombard

One of Babylon’s most significant partnerships is with Lombard, a startup also focused on integrating Bitcoin into the DeFi ecosystem. With participation from Babylon, Lombard has raised $16 million in order to explore the uncharted territory of Bitcoin restaking.

It is worth mentioning that the concept of restaking was first introduced on Ethereum through EigenLayer, a protocol that enables participants to restake their staked assets to secure other Ethereum applications and earn additional rewards.

This Babylon collaboration will leverage Lombard’s introduction of “liquid Bitcoin” (LBTC) tokens. This LBTC token refers to a tradeable receipt for Babylon deposits that will allow users to retain liquidity over their staked BTC.

Additionally, LBTC can be moved freely across different blockchains, providing users with flexibility and accessibility. This cross-chain capability ensures that Bitcoin holders can take advantage of DeFi opportunities across multiple platforms.

Lombard’s partnership with Babylon is part of a broader strategy to connect PoS chains with Bitcoin-backed security, offering endless DeFi opportunities to Bitcoin holders. This integration not only benefits users but also enhances the liquidity and security of the entire ecosystem.

Akash Network

Akash Network is a decentralized cloud infrastructure that gives users control over pricing and amenities while benefiting from efficient transactions and minimal environmental impact. The network's partnership with Babylon helps boost its security by integrating Bitcoin’s robust features into its Proof-of-Stake (PoS) system.

These security measures enable Akash to create a more secure and cost-effective way for users to record transactions and deploy workloads. The collaboration with Babylon strengthens Akash's market position by significantly enhancing security and efficiency.

Source: Akash

Additionally, this partnership grants Akash Network access to Bitcoin's reliable timestamping service and source of trust. This integration prevents double-spend attacks and allows for fast stake unbonding, providing users with greater flexibility and confidence in the security of their assets.

Ultimately, by leveraging Babylon’s technology, Akash can offer improved scalability, accommodating the growing demands of its user base. With advanced security measures, Akash Network aims to deliver a secure and cost-effective decentralized cloud solution, continuously pushing the boundaries in decentralized cloud computing.

Cosmos Hub

The Cosmos Hub is a network of independent parallel chains designed with the Cosmos software development kit (SDK). Through the Bitcoin staking protocol, Cosmos’ partnership with Babylon allows BTC holders to stake their coins to secure the Hub’s consumer chains and earn additional rewards.

Source: Cosmos

Cosmos’ blockchain ecosystem leverages Babylon’s Comet extension to enhance security aggregation to the Cosmos Hub blockchain and all consumer chains. In simpler terms, the integration of Babylon’s technology to the hubs prevents unpleasant scenarios, such as double signing.

Bitcoin Layer 2s

Although Bitcoin is arguably the most secure network in the crypto space, it still has some limitations, especially when it comes to smart contract functionality and support of other digital assets. This gap has spurred the development of Bitcoin Layer 2 solutions designed to expand Bitcoin’s capabilities.

However, these L2s often depend on third-party custodians or multi-sig bridges to facilitate their operations, which contradicts Bitcoin's decentralized ethos. Ultimately, this dependency can raise concerns about security and control, as users might find it difficult to trust these intermediaries to properly manage and secure their assets.

Fortunately, Babylon’s BTC staking protocol addresses these challenges by allowing users to stake their BTC directly. This enhances the security of PoS networks without the need for third-party custody or wrapping. This seamless integration benefits both the Bitcoin ecosystem and PoS networks.

Some Layer 2 projects have started utilizing Babylon’s Bitcoin staking protocol, including Lorenzo and Bison. Lorenzo, for example, is a BTC L2 infrastructure that focuses on yield-bearing token issuance, trading, and settlement. By leveraging Babylon’s staking protocol, Lorenzo enables native rollups to integrate native BTC assets and stake BTC for yield.

Meanwhile, Bison Network is a ZK-STARK rollup on Bitcoin that offers general programmability, allowing developers to design decentralized applications (dApps), smart contracts, and other DeFi tools. Bison basically provides Bitcoin-native smart contract functionalities, while using Babylon’s infrastructure to enhance its transaction efficiency and overall security.

Conclusion

Babylon taps from Bitcoin’s security architecture to secure Proof-of-Stake blockchains while allowing BTC holders to earn yields safely. Its innovative staking protocol ensures strong security for PoS chains while giving users liquidity and control. This project spotlights the fact that Bitcoin is not only a store of value but can also be a trusted security backbone for other blockchains. With strategic partnerships like Lombard and Akash Network, Babylon continues to strengthen its ecosystem and expand its role within the decentralized finance industry.

entry.title: The New Liquidity Pool Default: What Is Concentrated Liquidity?

content.__text:
Understanding Concentrated Liquidity

Concentrated Liquidity pools are liquidity pools on decentralized exchanges (DEX) in which you have to allocate liquidity in a custom price range. You will have full control over the price range and you can adjust it anytime at will. Concentrated Liquidity pools are more capital efficient than traditional “XYK” liquidity pools and have the potential to generate greater yields.

Key Takeaways

  • Concentrated Liquidity involves providing liquidity in a defined price range and requires active monitoring.

  • Concentrated Liquidity pools have the potential to provide extremely high returns.

  • Users have to be cautious of incurring too many fees when adjusting price ranges.

Is This a Concentrated Liquidity Pool?

If you’ve encountered terms like "Liquidity/Price Range", "Liquidity Shape” or “Trading Bins” it’s likely that you’re working with a Concentrated Liquidity pool. If those terms seems confusing to you, here’s a visual representation of what a Concentrated Liquidity pool might look like on Ambient Finance:

When providing liquidity in the example above for the ETH/USDC pair within a 10% range, your liquidity will only be active and generate trading fees if the market price of Ether falls between $2,304.03 and $2,815.25. In other words, if the market price of Ether moves more than 10% in either direction (up or down), your liquidity now becomes out of range and will cease to accrue fees.

Why Use Concentrated Liquidity

The concept of Concentrated Liquidity was first introduced by Uniswap V3 in March 2021 to tackle the capital inefficiencies inherent in traditional XYK liquidity pools. In those traditional pools, liquidity was spread uniformly across the entire price range from $0 to ∞. While this approach guaranteed liquidity at every price level regardless of market volatility, most of this liquidity went unused. With Concentrated Liquidity, liquidity providers can now focus their capital within narrower price ranges, enhancing capital efficiency and ultimately boosting their yields.

Concentrated Liquidity offers liquidity providers a high degree of flexibility and control over how they choose to allocate their capital. In doing so, they can sometimes experience very lucrative yields; however, they are highly variable because the yield depends on their choice of price ranges.

For example, on Ambient Finance, Concentrated Liquidity yields varies based on the price ranges chosen by each liquidity provider:

On the other hand, taking a look at the classic example of XYK-pools on Syncswap, all liquidity providers receive 8.94% yields.

Notice in the above examples, Concentrated Liquidity yields vary from 0.18% to 284.19%. This is because each liquidity position generates its own set of yield. Yield is no longer shared in a communal pool like in Syncswap’s XYK pools whereby all liquidity providers experience the same yield, 8.94%.

Cons of Concentrated Liquidity

While lucrative, Concentrated Liquidity positions require more effort to upkeep and there are multiple pitfalls that you have to watch out for.

Increased Oversight

As mentioned above, whenever your Concentrated Liquidity goes out of range, you will no longer be accruing fees. This means that Concentrated Liquidity positions require active monitoring as compared to the more passive XYK liquidity pools.

Here’s an example of what kind of oversight may be needed.

In the above example, the TIA/ETH liquidity position on Trader Joe is out of range. In order to fix this, you would have to first, remove your liquidity position, update your preferred liquidity provision range to current market prices and then redeposit the liquidity.

If you don’t adjust your liquidity position when it goes out of range, you won’t generate any yield. However, be cautious, as frequently updating the price ranges of your Concentrated Liquidity positions can be expensive. Balancing between the safety of a broader price range and the higher yields from a narrower range is often a complex choice.

Potentially Higher Impermanent Loss

In Concentrated Liquidity positions, whenever your position goes out of range, your liquidity becomes entirely denominated in one asset. For instance, in the example above, a previous 50/50 split of TIA/ETH has shifted entirely to ETH due to TIA’s relative price increase compared to ETH at the time of writing.

This differs from XYK pools, where your liquidity remains partially in both assets due to the infinite price range. As a result, impermanent loss can be more pronounced in Concentrated Liquidity pools compared to XYK pools.

Frequently Asked Questions

What Are Trading Bins?

The introduction of Concentrated Liquidity leads to the creation of the now widely used term “Trading Bins”. Concentrated Liquidity divides the previously continuous spectrum of price space into discrete segments, with Trading Bins representing the nominal boundaries for liquidity positions. While some DEXs simplify this by using straightforward price ranges such as in Ambient Finance, you might still come across the term Trading Bins in certain platforms.

On Meteora, you have many bin step options for any liquidity position:

Essentially, a larger bin step corresponds to a wider price range, whereas a smaller bin step indicates a narrower price range. The specific calculations for bin steps can vary depending on the platform.

What Are Liquidity Shapes?

In addition to Concentrated Liquidity, some DEXs, like Trader Joe, offer you the ability to choose your liquidity distribution shape, where you can allocate different amounts of tokens at diverse price points. There are various reasons for you to choose other options but in general, a uniformly distributed shape, “Spot” in this case would suit the purposes of most liquidity providers. Read here to learn more about the niche cases of other liquidity shapes.

Why Is Shifting Price Ranges Costly?

Shifting price ranges can be costly due to the accumulation of transaction and swap fees. When your position goes out of range, it becomes entirely denominated in one asset. If you then want to rebalance your position to a 50/50 asset split, you'll need to swap half of your assets before redepositing them.

Here’s a typical process:

  1. Remove TIA/ETH liquidity

  2. Swap half of the ETH to TIA

  3. Redeploy the liquidity

In addition to the swap fees incurred in step 2, you may also face price slippage during steps 1 and 3, which can further increase your costs. Therefore, it’s advisable to avoid frequently shifting price ranges.

How Often Should I Adjust Price Ranges?

This is largely dependent on your belief of current market prices, if you believe that prices will soon revert to previous levels. You might choose not to adjust your price range, as your position could return to being within range once prices drop.

Another consideration is the current yields of your liquidity position. If the yield you are able to obtain in the time before your position goes out of range is expected to be higher than the costs you incur while shifting price ranges, it may be worth it to adjust price ranges. Ultimately, some trial and error is expected here.

Conclusion

Concentrated Liquidity has become the preferred method for liquidity pools on many popular DEXs, including Uniswap, Ambient Finance, Thruster Finance, and others. Although it can be cumbersome, the focus on capital efficiency represents a significant advancement in DeFi, positioning it as the likely future direction for the space.

entry.title: What Is Zentry and the Metagame Layer

content.__text:
What Is Zentry (ZENT)?

In Zentry, your character can access a myriad of games, leveling up as they collect items from different virtual worlds. Zentry’s Metagame Layer is set to empower players through the Play Economy, where their game of games experience overlaps real life across multiple games, platforms, and social media.

Key Takeaways

  • The Metagame Layer is set to bring the MMORPG experience to real life, offering a platform where multiple players can create immersive experiences alongside other gamers.

  • Zentry’s Metagame Layer integrates loyalty systems, gamer identities, and cross-world activities from multiple games and platforms to create a vast, interconnected game of games.

  • Through these integrations, Zentry foresees turning game achievements and everyday activities into aspects of the world’s largest gaming adventure, constantly offering its players new opportunities for discovery and growth.

MMORPG (Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Games) is an online gaming genre where players take part in adventures alongside hundreds of other players in a virtual world. The Role Playing game (RPG) industry is expected to reach a valuation of over $70 billion by 2027 while the MMORPG global market is currently valued at over $20 billion with millions of players worldwide engaging in such games.

However, just like regular games, MMORPGs suffer from a lack of tangible rewards and a lack of player ownership. According to Zentry, “valuable data and revenue are harvested by corporations, leaving the true creators of this wealth — the gamers — without the reward they deserve”.

Zentry is introducing advanced gaming infrastructure that bridges Web2 and Web3 across identity, asset, and activity, leveraging the blockchain to usher gamers into a new world that puts them first.

Introducing Zentry

Zentry aims to bring the MMORPG experience to real life through a unified Play Economy that takes place across the digital and physical worlds. On Zentry, players can create an avatar that gradually evolves in status, uniqueness, and wealth through play across various ecosystems.

Zentry’s universe consists of multiple products, each with its own unique narrative and world, although they are connected by shared lore. At time of writing, the Zentry universe consists of:

Nexus: The metagame gateway for Web3, adding a gamification layer on top of social interactions (now available for X/Twitter).

Radiant: Radiant is Zentry’s cross-platform app that turns Web2 and Web3 gaming activities into a rewarding adventure.

Azul: An AI-powered gaming companion for Zentry that improves the productivity of gamers. According to the project, Azul adds more fun and makes online gamers more productive.

Zigma: Zigma is an upcoming NFT collection by Zentry inspired by anime and online gaming.

However, this isn’t just limited to games; for example, players could earn rewards for in-game achievements, but they can also earn rewards for real world activities like buying coffee from a partner store. These rewards can be in-game items on Zentry, which could be in turn exchanged for tokens, real-world rewards, or even NFTs with additional capabilities. Because of Zentry’s flexibility, it transcends the limitations of a traditional game, while offering an inclusive space where anyone – from casual gamers to speculators, collectors to token holders – can take part in the adventure.

History of Zentry

Before evolving into Zentry, the project was known as GuildFi, which was an interconnected ecosystem of Web3 games, guild communities, and NFTs that combined DeFi initiatives like financial incentives and rewards with GameFi. To better enable players to discover new games and guilds, GuildFi offered players a Guild Discovery feature that lets players discover curated games.

In its new form as Zentry, it has a new vision, new narrative, and a new token to power its universe. Zentry has a treasury of over $100 million in non-native assets, raised from top-tier VCs like Binance Labs, Coinbase Ventures, Animoca Brands, Hashed, and more. According to Jarindr Thitadilaka, co-founder and CEO of Zentry:

“Think of the Zentry as a new layer, which does the computing, gamifying, bridging, connecting and rewarding for everything that happens in other layers, permeating through various applications, platforms, and virtual worlds.”

The Metagame Layer

Imagine going on coffee runs with your friends and getting rewarded for it. This is what Zentry hopes to offer to its players with the Metagame Layer that brings the MMORPG experience to real life. The Metagame Layer integrates player identities, activities from several games and other consumer apps, along with a reward system into a single platform, allowing gamers to ‘live their real life in a virtual world’ and earn rewards.

The Metagame Layer is a synergy of

  • Blockchain technology

  • Selected consumer applications and

  • A multiversal IP world.

Using the blockchain, Zentry’s Metagame Layer creates a connection between Web2 and Web3 worlds, allowing users to bridge their data to the distributed ledger, where users can own, create and manage their assets and activities on this layer.

Zentry incorporates a story-driven and evolving product ecosystem into the metagame layer in an attempt to transform the lives of gamers. With the Metagame Layer, Zentry enables users to create a dynamic avatar profile that they truly own, where each player’s profile develops based on their engagement with activities on the platform.

According to the project, this arrangement ushers billions of MMORPG gamers into a unified Play Economy across digital and physical realms. Zentry embraces different factions of participants including gamers, investors, and NFT collectors. Each of these factions can engage in related activities and applications on the platform, contribute to the project’s growth, and earn rewards for their actions. The game’s economy is powered by the ZENT token.

What Is ZENT?

On April 25, 2024, Zentry migrated from the GuildFi (GF) token to the ZENT token in a 1:10 conversion ratio. The migration is meant to widen the project’s scope and improve the community’s experience. ZENT is the native token of the Zentry ecosystem, playing a central role in the project’s economy and governance. ZENT holders can benefit from extra income from Zentry’s shared value program, and will also play an active role in deciding changes to the project by taking part in the ZENTRY DAO. ZENT is also used to incentivize platform users through airdrops and other promotional events.

The total supply of ZENT tokens is 10 billion, about 40% of these tokens are currently in circulation. 14% of the total supply is allocated to the project’s treasury, 40% is reserved for ecosystem development and 15% is allocated to the team. 24% of the total supply will be used for fundraisers.

Migration From GuildFi to ZENT

Holders of the old GuildFi (GF) token are expected to complete their migration process on or before August 25, 2024 – the set deadline for migration. GF tokens held on exchanges will be automatically migrated to ZENT before this period. The conversion ratio is 1:10, that is GF holders get 10 ZENT tokens for each GF token held.

Visit the migration portal to convert your tokens

Read this guide for the migration procedure.

Nexus: Zentry’s Social Gateway

Creating a connection between Web2 data and Web3 is one of the major goals of Zentry. Nexus is the fourth flagship product and one that builds on the routine social activities of the users. Nexus is a social game where users interact with friends, perform usual activities on social media, and get rewarded according to Zentry’s economics. Each eligible activity is rewarded with Nexus SHARDS.

Users are required to connect their social profile on X (formerly Twitter) to Nexus. On the user’s approval, Zentry uses its multiversal API to connect to the social account track the user’s data in real-time and translate them to useful information for the platform’s operations. Users earn for interacting with posts from their friends, followers, and social media influencers. Each activity is weighted and rewards are distributed accordingly. Do note that content quality is more important than content quantity!

Final Thoughts

Zentry is building a base for multiplayer online games, while bringing together Web2 and Web3 gaming experiences. With the launch of Nexus, one of its four flagship products, players stand a chance of transforming their social time into an MMORPG experience where they can engage with their friends while earning rewards as part of the game experience. As the project continues to develop, we could see even more utilities develop from the platform.

Having said this, it is important to understand the provisions of the project. Zentry intends to build a home for games and gamers, using the blockchain as a connectivity infrastructure. In the course of this article, we attempted to explain the basic ideas behind the project, but this might not be exhaustive of everything the project offers. As an emerging project, keep in mind that the platform could be prone to significant changes. Also, note that this article only reviews Zentry for educational purposes and should not be taken as financial advice.

entry.title: Introducing GalaChain: The Chain for Web3 Gaming and Entertainment

content.__text:
What Is GalaChain?

GalaChain is a Layer 1 blockchain built for entertainment but ready for anything, created by Gala Games to power its growing entertainment ecosystem. GalaChain is built on Hyperledger Fabric (HLF) and powered by a network of Founder’s Nodes.

Key Takeaways

  • GalaChain is a Layer 1 blockchain developed by Gala to serve as the backbone of its Web3 entertainment ecosystem, including games, music and film.

  • GalaChain is built on the robust foundation of Hyperledger Fabric(HLF) and powered by a network of Founder’s Nodes.

  • The GALA token serves as the foundational utility token within the expansive Gala ecosystem, emitted daily to active Founder’s Node operators.

  • Following the successful implementation of GalaChain for Gala’s core entertainment brands, a publicly available SDK and creators toolkit opened in early 2024, extending GalaChain development to creators and innovators from industries beyond entertainment.

Introduction to GalaChain

GalaChain was initially built by pioneering web3 gaming platform and publisher Gala Games for the rapidly expanding demands of 21st century gaming. With its impressive speed, security and scalability, GalaChain is the backbone of Gala’s core family of brands, with Gala Music and Gala Film built on the network. This blockchain ensures that various components of the Gala ecosystem operate smoothly without the delays and high costs associated with other blockchains.

At its core, GalaChain is powered by a network of Founder’s Nodes. The central token, GALA, plays a crucial role, being burned as transactional gas fees and rewarding the node operators that power the ecosystem. As a Layer 1 blockchain, GalaChain also enables the creation of other tokens, channels and more specialized node networks, such as its game-specific nodes for titles like Common Ground World and Last Expedition, or its Theater Nodes, which host decentralized film content on the Gala Film platform.

GalaChain was designed with a clear objective: To robustly support the demands of Web2 gaming while adding Web3 functions (such as ownership and rewards) and extending its capabilities to other industries. The design philosophy behind GalaChain is simple yet ambitious: If it can seamlessly handle the intensive requirements of gaming, it can accommodate virtually any application or industry need. This approach positions GalaChain as a distinctly scalable blockchain solution with a head start on the tech demands of multiple industries.

The Team Behind GalaChain

Gala was founded in 2018 by Eric Schiermeyer, co-founder of Zynga and pioneering innovator of the social gaming genre. The founding team included some of the creators of social gaming hits like Farmville 2, Words with Friends and Zynga Poker. Zynga is recognized as a global leader in interactive entertainment, known for its social video game services. Farmville 2 is one of its standout agriculture-simulation social network games whose legacy is carried on with Gala’s Common Ground World, adding ownership, rewards and unique farm sim mechanics to a massively popular gaming genre.

Gala’s partnerships span a diverse array of reputable entities within the gaming and entertainment industries. These include DreamWorks Animation, an animation studio under Universal Pictures; AMC Networks, an entertainment company; and NBCUniversal, a multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate. Additionally, Gala has collaborated with iconic game developers such as Peter Molyneux and Will Wright. The company also works with music industry giants such as Snoop Dogg, Ice Cube, Brray, Kings of Leon and many more.

Since its inception, Gala has grown to be a leader in Web3 entertainment. The development of GalaChain exemplifies its commitment to innovation, providing a robust and versatile blockchain platform to support its expanding ecosystem.

How GalaChain Works

GalaChain combines advanced blockchain technology with a robust network infrastructure to create a versatile and high-performance platform for the Gala ecosystem.

Hyperledger Fabric (HLF)

GalaChain is built on the robust foundation of Hyperledger Fabric (HLF), which provides a modular architecture with interchangeable components such as consensus and membership services. This plug-and-play environment ensures that GalaChain can be customized to meet the specific needs of the Gala ecosystem. Hyperledger Fabric, a project initiated by the Linux Foundation in 2015, promotes the development of cross-industry blockchain technologies through a collaborative, community-driven approach.

One of the key features of Hyperledger Fabric is its private and permissioned nature, making it ideal for enterprise use. Companies like Honeywell, Walmart, and Bosch leverage HLF for their secure, scalable, and customizable private blockchains. For GalaChain, this means a stable and adaptable chain that supports the various components of Gala’s entertainment ecosystem.

GalaChain sets itself apart from other blockchains like Ethereum and Bitcoin which rely on non-permissioned, probabilistic consensus algorithms and are prone to ledger forks. GalaChain uses deterministic consensus algorithms with a specific type of node called an orderer, part of an ordering service. This asynchronous and multi-step process ensures that any block validated by a peer is final and accurate, eliminating the risk of ledger forks. By separating chaincode execution from the ordering process, GalaChain avoids bottlenecks, enhancing performance and scalability. The blockchain is designed to integrate smoothly with both Gala’s platform and the Gala Node Network.

Founder’s Nodes

The Founder’s Node Ecosystem is another cornerstone of GalaChain’s architecture. Limited to just 50,000 nodes, these operators are crucial in providing players with true ownership of their assets and content. By running a Founder’s Node, operators help maintain a decentralized infrastructure that supports complex, decentralized tasks tailored to specific project needs. Daily distribution from these Founder’s Nodes are the only way GALA originates.

Alongside Founder’s Nodes, many projects throughout the Gala Ecosystem are running individual Nodes with specialized workloads.The Gala Node Network supports custom-built tasks and provides a unique approach to project monetization, bypassing the complexities of traditional ICOs and reducing central costs. Their effectiveness is proven, serving as the backbone for existing applications and top-tier games.

Developed by experts who have built some of the largest gaming networks globally, these nodes offer unparalleled experience and scalability. This allows projects to expand their node network as needed, potentially eliminating the need for datacenter and cloud hosting expenses.

The scope of Founder’s Nodes operations is set to expand significantly in the near future. They are expected to take on critical responsibilities in bridge transactions and chain security, among other key functions. Their versatility and capacity to adapt to various roles ensure the robustness and agility of the ecosystem, making it well-equipped to meet both current and future challenges.

Features of GalaChain

The following features make GalaChain a sustainable and accessible platform for developers and users alike, supporting a wide range of applications within the Gala ecosystem.

Environmentally Conscious

GalaChain is designed to be environmentally conscious, consuming significantly less energy than other blockchain platforms while offering superior computational capabilities. This approach ensures that GalaChain remains sustainable and efficient, aligning with global efforts to reduce energy consumption in technology.

Developer-Friendly

GalaChain is highly developer-centric, providing extensive resources to make the platform more accessible and easier to use. Contracts and tokens can be efficiently created using TypeScript, which reduces onboarding friction for developers not familiar with specialized languages like Solidity. Developers on GalaChain have easy access to an open-source SDK with custom chaincode templates, simplifying the development process. Additionally, the ultra-simplified Gala Creator Portal allows innovators and developers to easily bring their visions to life on the Gala Platform, creating even more possibilities that they can create on chain.

The GalaChain Ecosystem

The GalaChain ecosystem integrates diverse platforms and applications, leveraging blockchain technology to enhance user experiences across gaming, music, film, and more.

Gala Games

As the cornerstone of the GalaChain ecosystem, Gala Games boasts a portfolio of 17 games, including 6 in early access and 3 coming soon. These games support various platforms such as browser, mobile (Android and iOS), Windows, and Mac.

Currently, 12 of these games have been onboarded on GalaChain, including Champions Arena, Legacy and The Walking Dead: Empires, leveraging its robust infrastructure to provide seamless and enhanced gaming experiences. The titles curated by Gala have recently been joined by Voyager: Ascension – the first 3rd party published game to onboard onto Gala’s platform. The integration of GalaChain ensures improved performance, lower transaction costs, and greater security, making it a vital component of Gala Games’ ongoing success and expansion.

Gala Music

Gala Music is a decentralized music streaming platform powered by GalaChain and IPFS. Artists can transform songs into NFTs and directly sell them on Gala Music without the large cut of traditional producers. Digital signatures for songs are uploaded on GalaChain as NFTs. MUSIC is the native token of the platform, and Gala Music boasts over 20,000 Jukebox Nodes, making it one of the largest DePIN networks. Jukebox Node operators are rewarded with MUSIC tokens for supporting the ecosystem along with artists, track owners and listeners

Gala Music allows artists to maintain ownership of their intellectual property, offering transparency and improved monetization. Fans benefit from direct engagement with musicians and exclusive access to content and merchandise. Supported by iconic artists like Snoop Dogg and Jordin Sparks, Gala Music has over 200 registered music creators.

Gala Film

Gala Film is a decentralized platform enabling filmmakers to tokenize their works as NFTs. This ensures transparency, security, and enhanced monetization, giving creators greater control over their intellectual property. Through direct engagement with audiences, filmmakers can offer exclusive access to content and merchandise.

Theater Nodes are the backbone of Gala’s decentralized film ecosystem. By owning a license and operating a Theater Node, users can contribute computing power to host cinematic content and receive daily rewards. Additionally, users can own Moments – unique scenes from films or series that generate rewards every time the content is watched. These Moments vary in rarity, providing a unique and rewarding experience for both creators and viewers within the community.

In addition, the FILM token is coming soon. FILM will serve as the utility token within the Gala Film ecosystem.

NFTs

The GalaChain ecosystem includes a variety of popular NFT collections encompassing in-game NFTs from Gala Games, music NFTs from Gala Music, and film NFTs from Gala Film. These NFTs provide unique digital assets that enhance user engagement and offer new monetization opportunities for creators. NFT enthusiasts can mint and transfer their NFTs on the GalaChain Inventory or through third-party marketplaces such as NFTHarbor.io.

Source: Footprint Analytics GalaChain NFT Dashboard

DeFi

GalaSwap enables direct token swapping on GalaChain, allowing users to trade GALA and other bridgeable tokens seamlessly. The GalaSwap Project Token Creation Tool allows the creation of custom tokens on GalaChain, also allowing creators to distribute mint allowances as they wish to addresses on chain.

The GALA Token

GALA serves as the foundational utility token within the expansive Gala ecosystem.

GALA

GALA is aimed at facilitating a seamless, secure mode of payment and incentivization among participants engaging within the network.

GALA acts as the primary reward mechanism for Founder’s Nodes, accruing GALA daily according to benchmarks based on uptime to support the network workloads.. Founder’s Nodes also receive distributions of other tokens in the ecosystem, as well as a small percentage of NFTs minted to GalaChain.

The token employs a Gnosis multisig safe, a secure arrangement ensuring that no single team member has unilateral access. This reinforces the principle of collective oversight and enhancing operational security.

The total supply of GALA is capped at 50 billion tokens. The daily emission rate is dynamically adjusted based on the circulating supply. This supply decreases when GALA is burned after being used as fees within the Gala ecosystem or spent on activities that support the ecosystem. GALA was launched without any pre-minting or initial allocation. All tokens were earned through Founder’s Node operation, with 100% of GALA allocated to Founder’s Nodes within the Gala ecosystem.

GalaChain Allowance

GalaChain Allowance is a system that grants rewards from running a node or other various reward mechanisms, allowing users to convert these rewards into on-chain tokens within their wallets at their convenience. Once a GalaChain Allowance is granted, users can choose to convert or fulfill the allowance, transferring the tokens to their GalaChain wallet.

This system ensures that the rewards or tokens are reserved for the user until they are ready to mint them, providing a flexible and cost-free method for managing rewards and in-game assets. It is an evolution of the previous Treasure Chest system Gala used prior to the debut of GalaChain, when tokens were minted on Ethereum. It allows users to have control over any costs or tax implications of minting.

What Is Next for GalaChain?

According to the Gala Ecosystem Blueprint, GalaChain’s roadmap for Q3 2024 includes several key developments aimed at enhancing its ecosystem. The upcoming Node Workload Development SDK will enable the creation of game-specific and activity-specific nodes, while the Chaincode Template Bounty Program will encourage innovation among community developers.

GalaChain plans to create more open-source options around utilizing its platform to go along with the GalaChain SDK developers are already using to spin up their own channels and deploy their own chain code to GalaChain. Furthermore, SDKs for Android and iOS will be developed to expand mobile development within the Gala ecosystem, along with an SDK for Unreal Engine to support advanced game development.

Looking ahead to Q4 2024 and beyond, GalaChain aims to build bridges to other prominent blockchain ecosystems, enhancing interoperability and the utility of the Gala Ecosystem. Plans are also in place for developers to have the opportunity to deploy Isochains on Founder’s Nodes, selecting the number of nodes needed to achieve desired resiliency levels. This will incentivize and reward node operators, ensuring their continued contribution to the network.

Conclusion

GalaChain stands as the cornerstone infrastructure for the Gala ecosystem, blending advanced blockchain technology with a robust network of nodes. Influential in Web3 gaming development, GalaChain plays a crucial role in the gaming industry innovation. With its innovative features, developer-friendly tools, and decentralized structure, GalaChain not only supports the diverse needs of the Gala ecosystem but also sets the stage for future advancements.

entry.title: What Is Sonic and How to Participate in the Sonic Odyssey Testnet

content.__text:
How to Participate in the Sonic Odyssey Testnet

To participate in the Sonic Odyssey Testnet you need a Backpack or Nightly wallet along with Sol test tokens, and then complete tasks to earn Ring Mystery Boxes and Rings.

Key Takeaways

  • Sonic is a platform built specifically for decentralized gaming to enhance the growth of game projects within the Solana ecosystem.

  • The project was launched by Mirror World Labs and has successfully raised $12 million in a Series A funding led by BITKRAFT and joined by Galaxy Interactive, Big Brain Holdings, and more.

  • Users can participate in the Sonic Odyssey testnet phase to interact with the platform and become familiar with its features.

What Is Sonic?

Sonic is the first atomic Solana Virtual Machine (SVM) Layer 2 solution built specifically for decentralized gaming. The platform aims to enable sovereign game economies that can roll up and settle on the Solana network. It is powered by the HyperGrid framework, a core technology developed by Mirror World that enhances customizability and scalability while remaining compatible with Solana’s Layer 1 services. This allows developers to deploy custom Sonic SVM chains and offers scaling advantages. Sonic itself is able to process millions of requests per second for games to create a high-performance environment for both developers and players.

Other than that, the platform also supports atomic interoperability to facilitate secure and efficient exchanges across multiple networks. This enables transactions on Sonic without needing to redeploy existing Solana programs and accounts. As a result, this feature lets developers leverage Solana’s Layer 1 services and liquidity directly. On top of that, Sonic is designed to offer fast transaction speeds with low costs in order to become one of the fastest on-chain gaming experiences available and can handle up to 50,000 transactions per second on its grids.

Sonic is also Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) compatible, allowing developers to write applications for EVM and execute them on Sonic’s SVM. As such, the platform is able to facilitate the seamless deployment of decentralized applications from EVM chains to Solana. Sonic has built-in mechanisms that help developers build and execute game development on Solana such as a sandbox environment, customizable gaming primitives, and extensible data types.

The team behind Sonic is Mirror World Labs, an organization building out Solana’s Web3 gaming infrastructure. Chris Zhu, CEO of MirrorWorld said, “We see Sonic’s modular SVM will be the key to unlocking the Solana gaming summer, onboarding thousands of games to launch and go to market with our support.”

Sonic recently raised $12 million in a Series A funding round led by BITKRAFT which received participation from Galaxy Interactive, Big Brain Holdings, and others. This funding is aimed at accelerating the development of the Sonic protocol and improving the gaming infrastructure on Solana.

Users can now participate in the Sonic testnet phase, called Odyssey, to interact with the platform and experience the available gameplay. With the Sonic mainnet expected to go live soon, now is a good time to get familiar with Sonic!

Do note that at the time of writing, the Sonic team has not made any official announcements on a future token launch or airdrop event. Therefore, following the steps below and participating in the Sonic Odyssey testnet phase does not guarantee a token airdrop allocation.

Step 1: Connect Wallet

First, head to https://odyssey.sonic.game/ and Connect Wallet in the upper right corner.

At the time of writing, the Backpack and Nightly wallets are the only options that support Sonic. You will need to use one of these in order to complete tasks and claim rewards.

In this guide, we are using the Backpack wallet.

Step 2: Request Sol Test Token

Before requesting Sol test tokens, you need to add the Sonic Devnet to your wallet. In your Backpack wallet, go to Settings which is found under Account.

Click on Preferences and turn on Developer Mode.

Then back in your wallet, Add Network under your wallet.

Type in Sonic Devnet and choose to enable it.

Now that you have the Sonic Devnet in your wallet, go to https://faucet.sonic.game/#/ and paste your wallet address in the space. Confirm Airdrop to receive your Sol test tokens.

Step 3: Complete Tasks

There are a few tasks you can complete to earn Ring Mystery Boxes. The first is to Meet Sonic and follow the protocol’s social media. Click Meet Sonic to be directed to the task page.

Click on Follow on X and authorize the app to access your account.

Then Join Discord which will open up your app and add you to Sonic’s Discord server.

After that, head over to the Check In task page where you can perform the daily check-in. The rewards for checking in is broken down as:

  • Check in for 1 - 7 days: 1x Ring Mystery Box

  • Check in for 8 - 14 days: 2x Ring Mystery Boxes

  • Check in for more than 14 days: 3x Ring Mystery Boxes

Therefore, checking in daily will help you earn more ring mystery boxes.

On the Referral page, you will find your invite code to share with others. Each successful invitee who completes the Meet Sonic task will reward you with a ring mystery box.

Lastly, you can head over to Game Adventure to explore the different games available. Sonic plans to keep adding more so be sure to check this page often for any new games.

At the time of writing, there are three available games which are SnakeLite, FoMoney meets 2048, and JogoJogo.

SnakeLite is a Telegram-based Tap-to-Earn GameFi built on TON while FoMoney provides on-chain gameplay that merges the classic 2048 mechanics with the incentive system pioneered by Fomo3D. Meanwhile, JogoJogo is a social entertainment platform that allows for predictions, gaming, and battles.

Step 4: Collect Rings

In the top right corner, next to the bell icon, you can check your ring mystery boxes and rings. Click Open Mystery Box to get your rings.

Choose how many boxes you want to Open and confirm the transaction in your wallet.

You will then receive rings that are automatically added to your profile. Performing more tasks and inviting others will earn you more ring mystery boxes.

Conclusion

Sonic SVM is the first Layer 2 solution specifically designed for enhancing the growth of gaming applications on the Solana blockchain. It was launched by the Mirror World team and is built on the HyperGrid framework to allow for high scalability and performance. The platform is currently running its testnet phase, allowing users to interact and become familiar with its features.
